National Project in Agricultural Communications
AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF LAND-GRANT COLLEGES AND STATE UNIVERSITIES • AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE EDITORS
WILLS HALL ♦ MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY
STANLEY ANDREWS EAST LANSING, MICHIGAN
Executive Director
December 23, 1957
Dr* Raymond D. Cheydleur
Assistant Director
Florida University Broadcasting Services
Gainesville, Florida
Dear Raymond:
I’m still partly under from the pace of the N.A.E.B. Research
Seminar, but am beginning to recuperate* At short range, the meeting
appears to have been highly successful* At long range, it should
prove to be even more successful,
I am enclosing a brief statement of NPAC interest in an inventory-
digest of radio research. You may recall that this matter came up toward
the close of the sessions, I hope that this statement will be a reminder
and that it will help identify people who might be interested in a venture
of this kind. From this beginning, it should be possible to fill in de¬
tails and develop a plan to produce a document that will be useful to the
many people concerned with radio broadcasting.
I should appreciate having your reactions to the approach suggested
and would be glad to supply additional explanations and details. In
addition, could you suggest interested and capable people who might be
approached on this matter?
This inquiry and enclosure are going to all the Seminar participants
in the hope that we can make an early start in this area.
With best wishes for Christmas and the New Year,
Sincerely yours.
John M. Parsey
Research Director
